newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan stocks activity buoyed by select trade.
newsitem.headline: Jordan stocks activity buoyed by select trade.

text.p: Jordanian stocks were barely changed on Sunday in higher turnover dominated by select trade on bluechip Arab Bank and leading industrials, dealers said.
The Amman Financial Market 60-share index fell a marginal 0.02 percent to 147.94 points in moderately high turnover worth 628,422 dinars ($963,873).
"The market at the beginning was going down but close to the end of trade improved on some select trade in drug and industrial shares with some outside buying," said one broker.
Brokers said Arab Bank woke up dormant trade on the market with a trade in the heavyweight stock, with 420,655 dinars changing hands.
Leading bluechip Jordan Cement, which may divest a 20 percent state-owned share of its 60 million dinar equity, was again one of the market's top gainers with a 0.10 dinar rise to 3.32 dinars.
For the second day, little traded General Investment was the market's biggest climber, rising 4.95 percent to 3.18 dinars with a marginal 200 shares changing hands.
The Amman bourse slipped below 136 points in July before rebounding above 152 points in September, buoyed by government pledges of commitment to economic reform.

But in October it moved less than a point either side of 147.50 points. Brokers said stalled self-rule talks between Israel and Palestinians and growing doubts that neighbouring Iraq will export oil in 1996 had added to domestic worries over high interest rates and paralysed the bourse.
Limited trading in a handful of shares has kept the market ticking over.
Overall 22 shares fell, seven rose and another 10 traded but closed unchanged.
